intro: Bonafousia tetrastachya, commonly known as the four-branched tetrastachya, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It produces small, elliptical berries that are typically red when ripe. Bonafousia tetrastachya is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its compact size and attractive foliage.
